title: Bangladesh national cricket team

coverImage.altText: Image of Bangladesh national cricket team

summary: The Bangladesh national cricket team, popularly known as "The Tigers", is administered by the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB). Bangladesh is a full member of the International Cricket Council (ICC) with Test and One Day International (ODI) status.

value.label: The Sher-e-Bangla National Cricket Stadium (SBNCS), also called Mirpur Stadium, is a cricket ground in Dhaka, the capital of Bangladesh. The ground holds approximately 25,000 people. The venue was taken over by the Bangladesh Cricket Board in 2004, as the home of both the men's and women's national teams.

image.altText: Image of Sher-e-Bangla National Cricket Stadium

value.label: In 1972, the government created the Bangladesh Cricket Board, then called the Bangladesh Cricket Control Board, with a directive to organise cricket in the new country.

The first full international team to visit Bangladesh was Sri Lanka in January 1978. Sri Lanka was then close to ICC Full Member status (achieved in 1982) and their higher standard was underlined by a series of innings victories in the three international matches against Bangladesh.
Pakistan visited Bangladesh for the first time. It was eight years after the end of the Liberation War but tensions were still evident.
The Bangladesh team played in the Cricket World Cup for the first time, having qualified by winning the 1997 ICC Trophy, for the 1999 tournament in Great Britain.
In April 2019, he was named as the captain of Bangladesh's squad for the 2019 Cricket World Cup.

image.license: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 4.0 International license.

value.label: Shakib Al Hasan is a Bangladeshi international cricketer who currently captains the Bangladesh national team in Test and T20I formats. He is considered as the best and greatest cricketer to have ever played for Bangladesh.

image.license: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 4.0 International license.

value.label: Mohammad Mushfiqur Rahim is a Bangladeshi cricketer and the former captain of the Bangladesh national cricket team.He holds the record for highest score by a test Bangladesh batsman.

image.license: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 3.0 Unported license.

value.label: Muhammad Tamim Iqbal Khan is a Bangladeshi international cricketer. A left-handed opening batsman, he is the Bangladeshi's most successful runscorer to date.
They appeared for the first time in World Cup in the 1999 Cricket World Cup as an associate team.
Bangladesh enjoyed a good tournament with two great wins against India and South Africa.

2007 का क्रिकेट विश्व कप (जिसे आधिकारिक तौर पर आईसीसी क्रिकेट विश्व कप 2007 के रूप में जाना जाता है) क्रिकेट विश्व कप टूर्नामेंट का 9वां संस्करण था जो एक दिवसीय अंतर्राष्ट्रीय (वनडे) प्रारूप में 13 मार्च से 28 अप्रैल 2007 तक वेस्टइंडीज में आयोजित हुआ था।
Bangladesh was a co-host with India for the 2011 Cricket World Cup.
The 2011 ICC Cricket World Cup was the tenth Cricket World Cup. It was played in India, Sri Lanka, and (for the first time) Bangladesh
Shakib Al Hasan became the first player in history to hold the number 1 positions in all three formats of cricket, in the all-rounder category on 12 January 2015.
